intro: Pedicularis kaufmannii, commonly known as the golden monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble the fur of a monkey. The plant is hemiparasitic, meaning it partially relies on its host plants for nutrients. It thrives in alpine environments and is often found growing on the stems of other plants. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
